ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Question for you druids out there ...
ygData.msgSnippet: I recently had grouped with someone who when he would ask for breeze, I would right then breeze him.  I asked very politely /g My Sow is gone, may I please get
ygData.messageBody:
I recently had grouped with someone who when he would ask for breeze, I would
right then breeze him.  I asked very politely

/g My Sow is gone, may I please get another?

No response, nothing.  Finally 10 minutes later, I asked politely again.  
Nothing. 5 minutes later he asked for a breeze, I breeze him and said /g May
I have a sow when you get enough mana?  Nothing.  At this point my husband
was telling me to leave the group.  But the others were great and I didn't
want to leave because of this guy.  Finally I asked one more time, again
politely, and he finally does it.


I'm a 17th level druid and have only experienced this a couple of times and
usually ignore them especially when they are rude about it.  My husband and
I both play at the same time and usually group together, and occasionally we
will pick up someone and group with them.  I think what I hate the most is
when the other people in the group ask for SoW's and do it quite rudely.

/g SOW me

HOW RUDE>>>!!!!

Usually when people do that I tell my husband that I want to leave the group
or don't buff that guy as much as the others.  I can't stand that.  If
people want to group because I know its better and you can fight more, lets
try not being so RUDE!

Nwinie
